meanings.definition: To divide into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She will trisect the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: Can you trisect the line into three equal segments?
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to trisect the pizza, making each slice perfectly equal.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to trisect the canvas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students how to trisect the circle accurately.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The trisection of the pie was done with precision.
meanings.sent2: The trisection of the land was necessary for the project.
meanings.sent3: The trisection of the budget caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The trisection of the city into districts was a strategic move.
meanings.sent5: The trisection of the play into three acts made it more engaging.
